problem_text:
Determine all pairs (S, G), where S is a semipartial geometry and G is
an almost simple flag-transitive group of automorphisms of S. A system of points
and lines (P, B) is a semipartial geometry with parameters (α, s, t, µ) if every point
belongs to exactly t + 1 lines (two different points belong to at most one line); every
line contains exactly s + 1 points; for any anti-flag (a, l) ∈ (P, B) the number of lines
containing a and intersecting l is either 0 or α; and for any non-collinear points a, b
there are exactly µ points collinear with a and with b.
A. A. Makhn¨ev
